intro: Ficus basidentula, commonly known as the narrow-toothed fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Moraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that have a distinctive narrow base and serrated margins. Ficus basidentula typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, often found in humid, lowland forests. Its unique leaf morphology and ecological adaptability make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
